column4: Senate Republicans got what they wanted: the confirmation of Amy Coney Barrett. Now, they’re skipping town without so much as a single vote on coronavirus aid. Americans deserve better. https://t.co/kfHQZqRlFC

Today, we're reminded how deeply out of touch recent SCOTUS rulings have been with public opinion. Affordable healthcare, a woman’s right to make her own healthcare decisions, collective bargaining, LGBTQ+ rights, gun safety measures – they’ve never been more threatened than now.

As coronavirus arrived on our shores, President Trump publicly told the American people not to worry. Behind the scenes? “Short everything.” 

There is no limit to this White House's corruption.

Today during #WorldSuicidePreventionDay, we are reminded of our responsibility to check in with loved ones and check up on our own mental health. Every 5 hours an Ohioan is taken from us as a result of suicide. Suicide is preventable, check in and check up. https://t.co/CIafhx044k

Today, I co-lead a bipartisan, bicameral effort urging that fisheries in the Great Lakes be made eligible for future COVID relief funding. This is a commonsense fix that must be adopted. TY @SenStabenow and the Members of the Great Lakes Task Force. https://t.co/Czk1eGFa2W

The economic damage to our commercial, charter, recreational, & tribal fisheries from this pandemic is staggering, suffering up to $50 million. Unfortunately, Great Lakes fisheries have not had access to the same relief funding available to other fisheries throughout the U.S.

1,760,000 confirmed coronavirus infections.

40,000,000 (Yes, million) jobless claims.

An economy in ruin.

Ongoing police violence and mass unrest in response.

If we are to overcome the coronavirus successfully, we must work together to secure and administer free coronavirus testing for every American who needs it.

Unfortunately, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has refused to hold a vote on the legislation. Not only that, but he has not scheduled a single coronavirus related vote for this week, despite holding the Senate in session.

The fact remains that testing and contact tracing will play a core role in our ability to safely reopen the country and return to work. It’s why I voted yes on the HEROES Act, which would commit another $75 billion for the testing, tracing, and treatment of COVID-19.

FCA has take innovative & industry leading measures to prevent infection among workers. Nobody wants to see Jeep, or any employer, become the next Smithfield, where hundreds of workers became infected with COVID. It's not Jeep's fault that testing remains scarce– that's on Trump.
As workers across our region return to the workplace, I'm concerned by the continued lack of testing needed to keep them safe. (Thread) https://t.co/Zs2wJUFNbh
